medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset of dyspnea and hypotension.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 2 hours before arrival during an airplane flight home from the Caribbean, starting with shortness of breath and pain in the left arm. The patient lost consciousness and possibly had a seizure, then awoke spontaneously with continued dyspnea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of childhood Hodgkinâ€™s lymphoma, treated with radiation therapy and chemotherapy. Developed pulmonary fibrosis, pleural effusions, esophageal dysmotility, and had episodes of aspiration pneumonia. Also had a spindle-cell sarcoma excised and diagnosed with ductal carcinoma in situ.
medical_history.social_history: Never smoked, consumed alcohol socially, lived with husband, worked as a social worker, and was physically active despite recent limitations due to dyspnea.
